Package it.nieels.unibs.pajc.h1v3.utility

Class XMLElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.nieels.unibs.pajc.h1v3.utility.XMLElement
  • public class XMLElement
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a single XML element as a java object.
    Author:
    Nicol Stocchetti

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      XMLElement​(java.lang.String _tag)
      A constructor which creates an empty and attributeless element.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAttribute​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Adds an attribute to this element's tag.
      void addChildElement​(XMLElement childElement)
      Adds a child element to the content of this element.
      void addText​(java.lang.String text)
      Adds a string of text to this element's content.
      java.util.ArrayList<XMLElement> findAllEnclosedElements​(java.lang.String tag)
      Finds all the child elements enclosed in this XML element which have a specific tag.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getAttributes()
      Returns the element attributes (unordered).
      java.util.ArrayList<XMLElement> getChildElements()
      Returns the child elements of this XML element.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> getContent()
      Returns this element's contents.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getOrderedAttributes()
      Returns the attributes' names in the same order they're placed inside the xml tag.
      java.lang.String getTag()
      Returns the element's tag.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether this object represents an empty element.
      void setAttributes​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> attributes)  
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String describing the XML element.

        _tag - the name of this element's tag, String.
